title_sort: alfred e. pratt to walt whitman, 29 september 1867
title: Alfred E. Pratt to Walt Whitman, 29 September 1867
text: WilliamsonSunday Dear Friend WaltI now take this opportunity of informing you that I am well at present and hope this may find you the same. it is getting late as I have rote[wrote] one letter this evening but as I have not heard anything from you in a great while I would rite[write] you a few lines but as I rot[wrote] last I think its your turn but I don't no[know] Are ofended[offended] about some thing, if I have ofended[offended] you in any way I am vary[very] sory[sorry] for it and hope you one as I ment no hurt now Friend Walt I have looke[looked] for you hear[here] for some time but have not seen you yet I would like to see you vary[very] much I dont[don't] think of much that will interest you so I must draw to a close so good by[bye] WaltThis from you FriendAlfred E. PrattWilliamsonWayne Co.New York Alfred E. Pratt to Walt Whitman, 29 September 1867
